record_data.record_title: Entergy Power, LLC, Market Based Rate Tariff
record_data.record_plain_text:
ENTERGY POWER, LLC
Market-Based Rate Tariff
1. Availability. Entergy Power, LLC (“Seller”) may make available under this Tariff wholesale energy, capacity, and ancillary services as follows:
a. Electric Capacity and Energy: Seller may sell electric energy and capacity from time to time at rates, terms and conditions established by agreement with the purchaser subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Tariff. All such transactions shall be voluntary.
b. Ancillary Services: The ancillary services that Seller may make available under this Tariff for purchase for resale are as follows:
i. RTO/ISO specific:
1. PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (“PJM”) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
2. New York: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc.
3. New England: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc.
4. California: Seller offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation (“CAISO”) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO.
5. MISO: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (“MISO”) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO.
ii. Third-party ancillary services: Seller offers Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers.
2. Applicability. This Tariff is applicable to all sales of electric energy, capacity, and ancillary services Seller, to the extent not otherwise subject to another tariff or rate schedule on file with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (“Commission”).
3. Rates. All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller.
4. Duration. This Tariff shall continue in effect until terminated or changed and such termination or change becomes effective in accordance with any applicable regulatory requirements.
5. Modifications. Seller may unilaterally apply under Federal Power Act Section 205 and the regulations promulgated thereunder to the Commission or other regulatory agency having jurisdiction for a modification of this Tariff.
6. Other Terms and Conditions. All other terms and conditions of sales shall be established by agreement between purchaser and Seller.
7. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the Seller’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Tariff.
8. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority.
Exemptions. By order issued September 29, 2011, Entergy Services, Inc., 136 FERC ¶ 61,218 (2011), the Commission conditionally granted limited waivers of the separation of functions and information sharing provisions in sections 35.39(c)(2)(i) and 35.39(d)(1) of the Commission’s regulations with respect to shared fuel procurement and outage scheduling operations at two fossil generating units co-owned by certain Entergy Operating Companies and certain of their market-regulated power sales affiliates. Id. at PP 22, 26.
Waivers and Blanket Authorizations. Seller has received (i) waiver of the accounting and reporting requirements contained in 18 C.F.R. Parts 41, 101, and 141, with the exception of 18 C.F.R. §§ 141.14 and 141.15; (ii) waiver of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subparts B and C, except for sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16; and (iii) blanket authorization for the future issuance of securities and the assumption of obligations or liabilities as guarantor, endorser, surety or otherwise in respect of any security of any person, pursuant to FPA § 204. See Entergy Arkansas, Inc., et al., Docket No. ER10-1763-____, et al.
9. Affiliate Authorizations.
By unpublished letter order in Docket No. ER90-38-000, dated November 2, 1990, the Commission accepted for filing a power coordination and interchange agreement between Seller and Entergy Arkansas, Inc.
10. Effective Date. This Tariff is effective upon the date authorized by the Commission.
11. Seller Category. Seller is a Category 1 seller in the Northeast, Northwest, Southeast, Southwest, and Southwest Power Pool regions and a Category 2 seller in the Central region, as the terms “Category 1” and “Category 2” are defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a).
record_data.filing_title: EPL Amended MBR Tariff for MISO
